pages.text: $(mat)When you first create a Material, you may notice that it doesn't have a name.$(p)This is to be expected -- as the discoverer of your new Material, it is your right to name it however you wish!
$(mat)To do this, you'll need a suitable work surface, so go ahead and make yourself a Discovery Desk.

$(mat)Placing a material inside the slot of the Discovery Desk will show its Formula on the right, and will show an option to $(bold)Discover$()$(mat) the material. Choose that, enter a name, and it will take on that name! $(p)You (and you alone) may also use the Discovery Desk to rename materials at your whim.$(p)Also, when hovering over a Material item, holding $(k:sneak) shows the name of the person who first discovered it.

$(mat)If you or anyone else create a Material with the same base ingredient (i.e. Salt Block) and a close enough mixture of Powers, the same Material will be produced, and it will bear your chosen Name.$(p)Additionally, discovering Materials adds them to a global list, visible from the $(item)Lightbulb Icon$(mat) in the Discovery Desk. $(p)That menu will also show the Formula of any Material you select, so don't worry about forgetting how to make one.
